messages: 180ec7709f5cc09152f473cb9e91d71f (16:43): -anyone know how to do the "render a model with a white background but with nice soft shadow" thing?
c7a0f7f681d241bad1095b1898691e52 (16:47): +my monitor was recently repaired... now it shows green colour on the left edge of everything
c7a0f7f681d241bad1095b1898691e52 (16:48): +but in GTK its not so
256ca4545b4a9dd6906acaefe73e189a (16:49): -no to get the shadows you are looking for
180ec7709f5cc09152f473cb9e91d71f (16:50): -hmm, area doesn't seem to generate shadows
256ca4545b4a9dd6906acaefe73e189a (16:51): -makes sure to turn down Energy to like .5
256ca4545b4a9dd6906acaefe73e189a (16:51): -as far as a back ground as white
256ca4545b4a9dd6906acaefe73e189a (16:53): -also the higher the sample rate the slower the render
180ec7709f5cc09152f473cb9e91d71f (16:54): -must be doing something wrong, no way it should be this slow
180ec7709f5cc09152f473cb9e91d71f (16:55): -nah, not worth the effort, its far from finished. Just wanted a nicer reference render scene
256ca4545b4a9dd6906acaefe73e189a (16:55): -I would just tell you what settings to change not crit the work.
dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (16:58): +Miikka^^: Look in the upper-right corner of blender. It will tell you
dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (16:59): +For the most part poly == faces
dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (17:00): +if you've got a scene full of objects...
dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (17:00): +But as a hack, you can go into edit mode, and add the modifier "decimate", which counts the faces for you
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (17:00): +well one way is to start a render with all the objects you care about in a render window
8690e5336e61480e2d389ec0187b68d4 (17:42): -anyone here knows how RC1's group feature is working?
